intro: Levya nicaraguensis, commonly known as the Nicaraguan levya, is a rare flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink and white. It thrives in humid, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and is of great interest to botanists and conservationists.
